subject: Re: [junit] Re: Friday fun ... write a JUnit test, make a buck (or $1.11 to be more precise)
msgSnippet: ... It took me a while to figure out how to actually see the task request . (hint: a task request is a HIT in Mechanical Turkish) -- Kevin
messageBody:
On 2/9/07, albsavoia <albsavoia@...> wrote:
>
>
>
> I must say that, even though I find the idea of Mechanical Turk quite
> intriguing, the interface is quite tricky to navigate and not very
> complete (e.g. I did not find a way to edit existing tasks, just
> expire them ahead of time).
>
> Alberto
>
>
It took me a while to figure out how to actually see the "task request".
(hint: a 'task request' is a 'HIT' in Mechanical Turkish)

--
Kevin

http://www.junitfactory.com
You send us code. We send you tests. For free.
